ext_descriptions.ext_description: A deprecated_interfaced_data_types is a set of names of interfaced data types that are kept in this edition in order to ensure upward compatability. Their usage is deprecated.
A deprecated_constructed_data_types is a set of names of enumerated and select data types that are kept in this edition in order to ensure upward compatability. Their usage is deprecated.
A deprecated_entity_data_types is a set of names of entity data types that are kept in this edition to ensure upward compatability. Their usage is deprecated.
A cc_design_approval is a type of . It relates an approval to a particular piece of product data.
a set of s which identify the data to which the approval applies.

A cc_design_certification is a type of that assigns a
to a product that is supplied by an external organization.

a set of s which identify
entities to which the certification is being assigned.

A cc_design_contract is a type of
that relates a contract to a .

a set of s which identify the versions of particular products to which the
contract is assigned.

A cc_design_date_and_time_assignment is a type of
that relates a to a particular piece of product data.
a set of s which identify the data to which the date and time is assigned.
The function which correlates roles of dates and times to elements of product data shall be satisfied.
A cc_design_person_and_organization_assignment is a type of that relates a to a particular piece of product data.

a set of s
which identify data to which the is related.

There shall not be any instance of for which the
function returns the value FALSE.
The dependent_instantiable_action_directive rule specifies that each instance of is dependent on the usage to define another entity.
For each instance of , there shall be a reference to the instance from an attribute of another entity.
The dependent_instantiable_derived_unit rule specifies that each instance of shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of that is not referred to by another instance.
The dependent_instantiable_document_usage_role rule specifies that each instance of shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of that is not referred to by another instance.
The dependent_instantiable_measure_with_unit rule specifies that each instance of shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of that is not referred to by another instance.

There shall not be any instance of that is not referred to by another instance.
The dependent_instantiable_precision_qualifier rule specifies that each instance of shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of that is not referred to by another instance.
The dependent_instantiable_product_definition_context_role rule specifies that each instance of shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of that is not referred to by another instance.
The dependent_instantiable_shape_representation rule specifies that all instances of are dependent on the usage to define another entity.
For each instance of , there shall be a reference to the instance from an attribute of another entity.
The dependent_instantiable_standard_uncertainty rule specifies that each instance of shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of that is not referred to by another instance.

There shall not be any instance of that is not referred to by another instance.
The dependent_instantiable_type_qualifier rule specifies that each instance of shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of that is not referred to by another instance.
The dependent_instantiable_uncertainty_qualifier rule specifies that each instance of shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of that is not referred to by another instance.
The dimensionality_is_two_or_three rule ensures that all instances of with a are defined in a two-dimensional or three-dimensional coordinate system.

Each shall have a
equal to two or three.

The event_occurrence_requires_event_occurrence_assignment rule ensures that each instance of that serves not as a base for another instance of is referenced by at least one instance of as the . This rule enforces the requirement for every to be assigned to product data at least once.

Each that is not used as a
by an instance of shall be used at least once as the
of an instance of .
The executed_action_requires_action_status rule specifies that each instance of shall be referenced by exactly one instance of as .
Each instance of shall be referenced by exactly one instance of as .

The geometric_representation_item_3d rule specifies that every must be founded within a that has a dimensionality of 3 except for use in defining the pcurve entity. This rule constrains all geometry to be three dimensional. The pcurve entity is an exception because it must be founded in a 2 dimensional context which is the parameter space of a surface.

For each instance of , the value of dim shall be three or the shall be used as an item in a .
NOTE - The use of the is to define points or curves in the parametric space of a surface for use by the pcurve.
The global_length_and_angle_units_2d_or_3d rule ensures that units of length and plane angle are given for every .
Each shall have at least two elements in its set of units.

Each
shall have exactly one and exactly one .

The person_requires_person_and_organization rule ensures that each instance of shall be referenced by at least one instance of as . This rule enforces the requirement for each person to have at least one organization specified to which the person belongs.

Each instance of shall be referenced by at least one instance of
as .

The restrict_applied_action_assignment rule enforces the correct correlation between the types of items in the set of items of an and the type of the
, and its associated .

If the has an associated with a description of 'activity element', the
shall be of type .
If the has no associated or has an associated with a description of 'activity element', the set of shall not contain items of type .

If the role has a name of 'test activity', only items of type
shall be in the set of items.
The restrict_applied_action_request_assignment rule enforces the correct correlation between the types of items in the set of items of an and its associated .
The shall only be referenced by instances that have a name of 'scope'.
The restrict_applied_event_occurrence_assignment rule ensures that each instance of that provides the context for an contains exactly one element in its set of items.
Each that has a role with a name of 'event context' shall contain exactly one element in its set of items.
The restrict_applied_organizational_project_assignment rule enforces the correct correlation between the types of items in the set of items of an and its associated .
If the role has a name of 'affecting project', only items of type shall be in the set of items.
If the role has a name of 'work program', only items of type shall be in the set of items.
The restrict_approval rule specifies the constraints that apply to an approval and to an in the context of this application module.
Each approval shall be referenced by at most two .
Each shall have an . This shall have a name of either 'actual' or 'planned'.
Each shall be referenced by at most one that has a name of 'actual'.
Each approval shall be referenced by at most one that has a name of 'planned'.
The restrict_date_assignment rule constrains instances of when role name is 'actual end'.
For any instance of , if the role has a name of 'actual end', only items of type , or shall be in the set of items.
The restrict_effectivity_for_effectivity_relationship rule restricts the types of effectivity that may participate in an .

The
and the
of an
may not be of type , , or .
The restrict_external_identification_assignment rule constrains instances of according to their role name.
If the role has a name of 'alternative document id and location', only items of type shall be in the set of items.

of either 'description' or 'name'.

The restrict_organization_assignment rule constrains the instances of .
If the role has a name of 'organization in contract', only items of type shall be in the set of items.
If the role has a name of 'signing for contract', only items of type shall be in the set of items.

If the role has a name of 'validity context', only items of type
shall be in the set of items.
If the role has a name of 'alias scope', only items of type shall be in the set of items.

The restrict_product_category_value rule restricts the values of the
attribute of a .

The values of the attribute of a must be one of 'assembly','detail','customer_furnished_equipment','inseparable_assembly','cast','coined','drawn','extruded','forged','formed','machined','molded','rolled', or 'sheared'.

The restrict_product_definition_context_for_product rule ensures the correct correlation between the name of the which is referenced as the
by a
and the
of the associated .

If the
references as its
a with a name of 'functional definition', this
shall reference as its formation a
that references as
a
that is in the set of of a .

The restrict_product_definitions_for_product_definition_relationship rule ensures the correct correlation between the name or type of the
and the of the related s.

If the
is of type , the
and the
shall either both reference as their
a with a name of 'part definition', or shall both reference as their a with a name of 'physical occurrence'.
The restrict_properties_of_document_file rule specifies the restrictions that apply for properties of s.
Each instance of shall be referenced as definition by at most one with a name of 'document property'.

Each instance of shall reference as
an instance of with a name of either 'digital', or 'physical'.
The restrict_properties_of_document_representation rule specifies the restrictions that apply for properties of document representations.

Each instance of
that references as
an with a name of either 'physical document definition', 'digital document definition', or 'physical model occurrence' shall be referenced as definition by at most one with a name of 'document property'.
The restrict_representation_for_document_content_property rule specifies the restrictions that apply for representations with a name of 'document content'.
For each instance of which has a name of 'document content' there shall be at least one and at most three instances of in the set of items.
Each instance of that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document content' shall have a name of either 'detail level', 'geometry type', or 'real world scale'.
There shall be at most one instance of that has a name of 'detail level' and which is of type that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document content'.
There shall be at most one instance of that have a name of 'geometry type' and which is of type that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document content'.
There shall be at most one instance of that have a name of 'real world scale' and which is either of type , or that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document content'.
The restrict_representation_for_document_creation_property rule specifies the restrictions that apply for s with a name of 'document creation'.

For each instance of
which has a name of 'document creation' there shall be at least one and at most three instances of s in the set of items.
Each instance of that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document creation' shall have a name of either 'creating interface', 'creating system', or 'operating system'.
There shall be at most one instance of that have a name of 'creating interface' and which is of type that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document creation'.
There shall be exactly one instance of that have a name of 'creating system' and which is of type that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document creation'.
There shall be at most one instance of that have a name of 'operating system' and which is of type that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document creation'.
The restrict_representation_for_document_format_property rule specifies the restrictions that apply for s with a name of 'document format'.
For each instance of which has a name of 'document format' there shall be at least one and at most three instances of in the set of items.
Each instance of that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document format' shall have a name of either 'character code', or 'data format'.
There shall be at most one instance of that have a name of 'character code' and which is of type that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document format'.
There shall be at most one instance of that have a name of 'data format' and which is of type that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document format'.
There shall be at most one instance of that have a name of 'size format' and which is of type that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document format'.

The restrict_representation_for_document_properties rule specifies that each instance of with a name of 'document property' shall be represented by s with a name of either 'document content', 'document creation', 'document format', or 'document size'. At the same time, this rules enforces that each instance of with a name of either 'document content', 'document creation', 'document format', or 'document size', shall be referenced by one instance of with a name of 'document property'.

Each instance of with a name of 'document property' shall be referenced as definition by a , which has as
a with a name of either 'document content', 'document creation', 'document format', or 'document size'.

Each instance of with a name of either 'document content', 'document creation', 'document format', or 'document size' shall be referenced as
by a
, which has as definition a with a name of 'document property'.

Each instance of with a name of either 'document content', 'document creation', 'document format', or 'document size' shall reference as
a , with a
of 'document parameters'.

Each instance of
with a
of 'document parameters' shall be referenced as
by a
with a name of either 'document content', 'document creation', 'document format', or 'document size'.
The restrict_representation_for_document_size_property rule specifies the restrictions that apply for s with a name of 'document size'.

For each instance of
which has a name of 'document size' there shall be at least one and at most two instances of
in the set of items.

Each instance of
that is referenced as items by an instance of
with a name of 'document size' shall have a name of either 'file size', or 'page count'.

There shall be at most one instance of
that have a name of 'file size' and which is either of type , , or that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document size'.

There shall be at most one instance of
that have a name of 'page count' and which is either of type , , or that is referenced as items by an instance of
with a name of 'document size'.

Each instance of shall be used at least once as the
by an instance of .
The subtype_exclusiveness_classification_assignment rule specifies that the subtypes of are mutually exclusive.
The subtype_exclusiveness_effectivity rule specifies that the subtypes of are mutually exclusive, except for , , and .
Each instance of the subtypes of an shall be only one of , .

The versioned_action_request_requires_status rule specifies that each instance of shall have exactly one status. The status of a is defined by the entity.
the set of all instances of .

The at_most_one_version_id function evaluates for an instance of any type if there is more than one
with role name 'version'. If there is more than one of such of , the function returns FALSE.
the instance that is considered.

The assembly_shape_is_defined function accepts a
as input and returns a boolean result. The function will return true if the shape is defined for the
which is the
and the shape is defined for the
which is the
in the , and the two shapes are related through a , and the two relationships are related through . The function will also return true if the shape of the or the is not defined. The only time this function will return false is when the shapes are defined for the and the and related through a , but the and the are not explicitly related through .

ext_description.p: The cc_design_date_time_correlation boolean function returns true if the name attribute value of the entity is coordinated with the type of entity selected in the items of the entity.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The value_range_aggregate_rep_item function accepts a set of and returns a boolean result. The function will return TRUE if there are exactly three elements in the set and all are of type . Else it will return FALSE.
the set of instances that is considered.

The item_correlation function accepts a set of GENERIC and a set of STRING as input and returns a boolean result. The function will return TRUE if all elements of the first set are in the set of types that is generated from the second set. Else it will return FALSE.
the set of instances that is considered.
the set of entity names compared with the type of the element of items.

The allowed_translations function checks for an instance if language indication and translations are provided correctly and for the right attributes. In that case, it returns TRUE else it returns FALSE.
the instance that is considered.
the set of names of attributes for which a language indication or a translation is allowed.

ext_description.p: The cc_design_person_and_organization_correlation boolean function returns true if the is coordinated with the type of entity selected in .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the to be checked.

The function that correlates roles of persons
and organizations to elements of product data shall be satisfied.

A cc_design_security_classification is a type of .
It relates a to a particular piece of product data.

a set of s which identify the versions or definition relationships of particular
products to which the is assigned.

A cc_design_specification_reference is a type of
that relates a reference to a specification to a complete definition of a product or to some aspect of its shape.
a set of and / or to which the specification reference applies.

A change is a type of
that identifies the s that have been incorporated into the design and, as a result,
have established a new version of the product.

a set of s which identify versions of particular products which were created as a
result of the incorporation of the change.

A change_request is a type of
that is a formal notification of a desire for a modification to a particular piece of product data.
a set of change_request_items which identify versions of particular products to be changed.

A design_context is a type of
that defines a life cycle stage of design as the frame of reference for entities.
the of the design_context entity shall contain the value design.

A design_make_from_relationship is a type of
that specifies that one products design has been derived from another products design. The use of the design_make_from_relationship also implies that the physical product resulting from the manufacture of the
is to be used as the basis for the manufacture of the .

A mechanical_context is a type of
that is applicable to those products that are mechanical. The use of this entity defines a viewpoint for the context of a product. It is not intended to be a classification or categorization of a type of product. The definition of the
to be mechanical using this entity is specifying the way that the product acts within the data exchange. A printed circuit assembly is defined in a mechanical context when its physical properties such as shape are of interest, and are defined so that its fit within the assembly in which it used may be specified. Other properties of the printed circuit assembly such as connectivity requirements and functional requirements would not be specified in a mechanical context.
the of the mechanical_context entity shall contain the value mechanical.
A start_request is a type of that is a formal notification of a desire to begin a new design for a product or group of products.
a set of s which identify the versions of particular products.

A start_work is a type of
that identifies the s that have been fulfilled and, as a result, have established a new version of a product.

a set of s which identify versions of products that are to be created as a result of
the start of the work.

A supplied_part_relationship is a type of that relates the identifications of two products and specifies that one is the identification used by the internal design organization and the other is the identification used by a supplier.

ext_description.p: The cc_design_date_time_correlation boolean function returns true if the name attribute value of the entity is coordinated with the type of entity selected in the items of the entity.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the to be checked.
The schema_name constant specifies an upper case representation of the name of the present Express schema.
The dependent_instantiable_dimensional_size rule specifies that each instance of dimensional_size shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of dimensional_size that is not referred to by another instance.
The dependent_instantiable_tolerance_value rule specifies that each instance of tolerance_value shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of tolerance_value that is not referred to by another instance.

The restrict_multi_language_for_geometric_tolerance rule specifies that each instance of geometric_tolerance shall only be referenced by instances of multi_language_attribute_assignment or attribute_language_assignment that have an attribute attribute_name that is 'description' or 'name'.
There shall not be any instance of geometric_tolerance for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

The restrict_multi_language_for_topological_representation_item rule specifies that each instance of
shall only be referenced by instances of
or
that have an attribute
that is 'name'.

There shall not be any instance of
for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

The restrict_zone_boundary rule ensures that any
is bounded by at most two s.

Each instance of
shall refer to at most two s
as boundaries.

The subtype_exclusiveness_founded_item rule specifies that the subtypes of
are mutually exclusive.

Each instance of the subtypes of an
shall be only one of , , view_volume.
The subtype_exclusiveness_representation rule specifies that the subtypes of representation are mutually exclusive, except for .

Each instance of the subtypes of a
shall be only one of , , , , , .

The subtype_exclusiveness_shape_aspect_relationship rule specifies that the subtypes of
are mutually exclusive.

Each instance of the subtypes of a
shall be only one of , , , shape_defining_relationship.

The subtype_exclusiveness_shape_representation_geometry rule specifies the subtypes of
that are mutually exclusive.

Each instance of the subtypes of a
shall be only one of , , , , , , .
The subtype_mandatory_founded_item rule ensures that all entities are of type , , or.
Each shall be of type , , or .

The approval_person_organization_requires_date_time rule specifies that each instance of shall be referenced by exactly one of either or where the assigned date or date and time specifies the sign off date of the approval. This rule enforces the requirement for every approval, that, in case the approving person or organization is specified, also the sign off date of the Approval has to be given.
There shall be exactly one instance of either or associated to an where the name of , respectively , is 'sign off'.

The approval_requires_approval_assignment rule specifies that each instance of is referenced by at least one instance of as the . This rule enforces the requirement for every to be applied at least once.
Each instance of shall be referenced at least once as the by an instance of .

The application_protocol_definition_required rule ensures that at least one
is specified that provides the designator 'ap203 configuration controlled 3d design of mechanical parts and assemblies' of this application protocol.

At least one instance of
shall be refered by one instance of
which contains the instance of
as its
attribute and has a
of 'ap203 configuration controlled 3d design of mechanical parts and assemblies'.
